<center><h3>**The North Atlantic Aerosols and Marine Ecosystems Study (NAAMES)**</h3><center>
<br>
<center><p style="font-family:Geneva;text-align:left;color:black;font-size:20px;text-align:justify">NAAMES was a five-year NASA study (2015-2019) that looked at the influences of phytoplankton on atmospheric aerosols and clouds. As part of NAAMES, the contribution of Dr. Stephen Giovannoni and myself was to generate 16S rRNA amplicon profiles to have a highly-resolved identification of the plankton communties.<br> I participated in 3 out of 4 field campaigns. Find more details for each campaign in the buttons below </p></center>
<p style="text-align:left;color:black;font-size:18px;"> Click the links below for more informartion about the NAAAMES project.</p>
[**NAAMES official website**](https://naames.larc.nasa.gov) <br>
[**Notes from the field NASA Earth Observatory**](https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/blogs/fromthefield/category/naames/)<br>
[**Tiny organisms, giant impact**](https://climate.nasa.gov/news/2621/tiny-organisms-giant-impact/)<br>

## NAAMES 4
<p style="font-family:Geneva;text-align:left;color:black;font-size:16px;">NAAMES 4 took place in March-April 2018. Departing from San Juan, PR to the first station at latitude ~32 N.</p> <br>

<p style="text-align:middle;color:black;font-size:18px;">This cruise was featured on Chronicle 5 WCVB. Click on the links to see the videos.</p> <br>
